main event: Multiple unidentified aerial objects (UFOs) were observed over Okinawa by military, government personnel, and civilians on November 4, 1954, and November 6, 1954.
interesting points: The objects observed were described as round, oval, and changing in shape and color from white to orange to red.

One object was estimated to be 30 feet in diameter and completely silent in flight, while another was the size of a standard 55-gallon oil drum and traveling at an estimated speed of 500 miles per hour.
The objects were observed to remain stationary for a few minutes before accelerating and climbing at a rapid rate of speed, disappearing from view.
Some objects were seen moving in erratic formations and changing shapes while flying at high speeds.
The sightings involved multiple credible witnesses, including USAF, USMC personnel, and civilian military employees.
witnesses: military personnel, government employees, and civilians
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
